content: Use words and phrases acquired through conversations, reading and being read to, and responding to texts, including using frequently occurring conjunctions to signal simple relationships (e.g., because).
With guidance and support from adults, demonstrate understanding of word relationships and nuances in word meanings.
Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on grade 1 reading and content, choosing flexibly from an array of strategies.
(Begins in grade 2)
Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing.
Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking.

Acquire and use accurately a range of general academic and domain-specific words and phrases sufficient for reading, writing, speaking, and listening at the college and career readiness level; demonstrate independence in gathering vocabulary knowledge when encountering an unknown term important to comprehension or expression.
meta: College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Language

content: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word meanings.
meta: College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Language

content: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases by using context clues, analyzing meaningful word parts, and consulting general and specialized reference materials, as appropriate.
meta: College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Language

content: Apply knowledge of language to understand how language functions in different contexts, to make effective choices for meaning or style, and to comprehend more fully when reading or listening.
meta: College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Language

content: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing.
meta: College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Language

content: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking.
meta: College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Language

content: Produce complete sentences when appropriate to task and situation.
Add drawings or other visual displays to descriptions when appropriate to clarify ideas, thoughts, and feelings.
Describe people, places, things, and events with relevant details, expressing ideas and feelings clearly.
Ask and answer questions about what a speaker says in order to gather additional information or clarify something that is not understood.
Ask and answer questions about key details in a text read aloud or information presented orally or through other media.
Participate in collaborative conversations with diverse partners about grade 1 topics and texts with peers and adults in small and larger groups
Adapt speech to a variety of contexts and communicative tasks, demonstrating command of formal English when indicated or appropriate.
meta: College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Speaking and Listening

content: Make strategic use of digital media and visual displays of data to express information and enhance understanding of presentations.
meta: College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Speaking and Listening

content: Present information, findings, and supporting evidence such that listeners can follow the line of reasoning and the organization, development, and style are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience.
meta: College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Speaking and Listening

content: Evaluate a speaker's point of view, reasoning, and use of evidence and rhetoric.
meta: College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Speaking and Listening

content: Integrate and evaluate information presented in diverse media and formats, including visually, quantitatively, and orally.
meta: College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Speaking and Listening

content: Prepare for and participate effectively in a range of conversations and collaborations with diverse partners, building on others' ideas and expressing their own clearly and persuasively.
meta: College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Speaking and Listening

content: (Begins in grade 2)
(Begins in grade 4)
meta: Research to Build and Present Knowledge

content: With guidance and support from adults, recall information from experiences or gather information from provided sources to answer a question.
meta: Research to Build and Present Knowledge

content: Participate in shared research and writing projects (e.g., explore a number of "how-to" books on a given topic and use them to write a sequence of instructions).
meta: Research to Build and Present Knowledge

content: With guidance and support from adults, use a variety of digital tools to produce and publish writing, including in collaboration with peers.
With guidance and support from adults, focus on a topic, respond to questions and suggestions from peers, and add details to strengthen writing as needed.
(Begins in grade 2)

Write narratives in which they recount two or more appropriately sequenced events, include some details regarding what happened, use temporal words to signal event order, and provide some sense of closure.
Write informative/explanatory texts in which they name a topic, supply some facts about the topic, and provide some sense of closure.
Write opinion pieces in which they introduce the topic or name the book they are writing about, state an opinion, supply a reason for the opinion, and provide some sense of closure.
Write routinely over extended time frames (time for research, reflection, and revision) and shorter time frames (a single sitting or a day or two) for a range of tasks, purposes, and audiences.
meta: College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Writing

content: Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research.
meta: Research to Build and Present Knowledge
College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Writing

content: Gather relevant information from multiple print and digital sources, assess the credibility and accuracy of each source, and integrate the information while avoiding plagiarism.
meta: Research to Build and Present Knowledge
College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Writing

content: Conduct short as well as more sustained research projects based on focused questions, demonstrating understanding of the subject under investigation.
meta: Research to Build and Present Knowledge
College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Writing

content: Use technology, including the Internet, to produce and publish writing and to interact and collaborate with others.
meta: College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Writing

content: Develop and strengthen writing as needed by planning, revising, editing, rewriting, or trying a new approach.
meta: College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Writing

content: Produce clear and coherent writing in which the development, organization, and style are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience.
meta: College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Writing

content: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, well-chosen details, and well-structured event sequences.
meta: College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Writing

content: Write informative/explanatory texts to examine and convey complex ideas and information clearly and accurately through the effective selection, organization, and analysis of content.
meta: College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Writing

content: Write arguments to support claims in an analysis of substantive topics or texts, using valid reasoning and relevant and sufficient evidence.
meta: College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Writing

content: Read with sufficient accuracy and fluency to support comprehension.
Know and apply grade-level phonics and word analysis skills in decoding words both in isolation and in text.
Demonstrate understanding of spoken words, syllables, and sounds (phonemes).
Demonstrate understanding of the organization and basic features of print.
With prompting and support, read informational texts appropriately complex for grade 1.
meta: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

content: Identify basic similarities in and differences between two texts on the same topic (e.g., in illustrations, descriptions, or procedures).
Identify the reasons an author gives to support points in a text.
Use the illustrations and details in a text to describe its key ideas.
Distinguish between information provided by pictures or other illustrations and information provided by the words in a text.
Know and use various text structures (e.g., sequence) and text features (e.g., headings, tables of contents, glossaries, electronic menus, icons) to locate key facts or information in a text.
Ask and answer questions to help determine or clarify the meaning of words and phrases in a text.(See grade 1 Language standards 4–6 for additional expectations.)
Describe the connection between two individuals, events, ideas, or pieces of information in a text.
Identify the main topic and retell key details of a text.
Ask and answer questions about key details in a text.
With prompting and support, read prose and poetry of appropriate complexity for grade 1.
meta: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

content: Compare and contrast the adventures and experiences of characters in stories.
Use illustrations and details in a story to describe its characters, setting, or events.
(Not applicable to literature)
Identify who is telling the story at various points in a text.
Explain major differences between books that tell stories and books that give information, drawing on a wide reading of a range of text types.
Identify words and phrases in stories or poems that suggest feelings or appeal to the senses. (See grade 1 Language standards 4–6 for additional expectations.)
Describe characters, settings, and major events in a story, using key details.
Retell stories, including key details, and demonstrate understanding of their central message or lesson.
Ask and answer questions about key details in a text.
Read and comprehend complex literary and informational texts independently and proficiently.
meta: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity
College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Reading

content: Analyze how two or more texts address similar themes or topics in order to build knowledge or to compare the approaches the authors take.
meta: College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Reading

content: Delineate and evaluate the argument and specific claims in a text, including the validity of the reasoning as well as the relevance and sufficiency of the evidence.
meta: College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Reading

content: Integrate and evaluate content presented in diverse media and formats, including visually and quantitatively, as well as in words.
meta: College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Reading

content: Assess how point of view or purpose shapes the content and style of a text.
meta: College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Reading

content: Analyze the structure of texts, including how specific sentences, paragraphs, and larger portions of the text (e.g., a section, chapter, scene, or stanza) relate to each other and the whole.
meta: College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Reading

content: Interpret words and phrases as they are used in a text, including determining technical, connotative, and figurative meanings, and analyze how specific word choices shape meaning or tone.
meta: College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Reading

content: Analyze how and why individuals, events, and ideas develop and interact over the course of a text.
meta: College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Reading

content: Determine central ideas or themes of a text and analyze their development; summarize the key supporting details and ideas.
meta: College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Reading

content: Read closely to determine what the text says explicitly and to make logical inferences from it; cite specific textual evidence when writing or speaking to support conclusions drawn from the text.
meta: College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Reading

content: Distinguish shades of meaning among verbs differing in manner (e.g., look, peek, glance, stare, glare, scowl) and adjectives differing in intensity (e.g., large, gigantic) by defining or choosing them or by acting out the meanings.
meta: With guidance and support from adults, demonstrate understanding of word relationships and nuances in word meanings.

content: Identify real-life connections between words and their use (e.g., note places at home that are cozy).
meta: With guidance and support from adults, demonstrate understanding of word relationships and nuances in word meanings.

content: Define words by category and by one or more key attributes (e.g., a duck is a bird that swims; a tiger is a large cat with stripes).
meta: With guidance and support from adults, demonstrate understanding of word relationships and nuances in word meanings.

content: Sort words into categories (e.g., colors, clothing) to gain a sense of the concepts the categories represent.
meta: With guidance and support from adults, demonstrate understanding of word relationships and nuances in word meanings.

content: Identify frequently occurring root words (e.g., look) and their inflectional forms (e.g., looks, looked, looking).
meta: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on grade 1 reading and content, choosing flexibly from an array of strategies.

content: Use frequently occurring affixes as a clue to the meaning of a word.
meta: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on grade 1 reading and content, choosing flexibly from an array of strategies.

content: Use sentence-level context as a clue to the meaning of a word or phrase.
meta: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on grade 1 reading and content, choosing flexibly from an array of strategies.

content: Spell untaught words phonetically, drawing on phonemic awareness and spelling conventions.
meta: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing.

content: Use conventional spelling for words with common spelling patterns and for frequently occurring irregular words.
meta: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing.

content: Use commas in dates and to separate single words in a series.
meta: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing.

content: Use end punctuation for sentences.
meta: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing.

content: Capitalize dates and names of people.
meta: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing.

content: Produce and expand complete simple and compound declarative, interrogative, imperative, and exclamatory sentences in response to prompts.
meta: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking.

content: Use frequently occurring prepositions (e.g., during, beyond, toward).
meta: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking.

content: Use determiners (e.g., articles, demonstratives).
meta: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking.

content: Use frequently occurring conjunctions (e.g., and, but, or, so, because).
meta: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking.

content: Use frequently occurring adjectives.
meta: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking.

content: Use verbs to convey a sense of past, present, and future (e.g., Yesterday I walked home; Today I walk home; Tomorrow I will walk home).
meta: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking.

content: Use personal (subject, object), possessive, and indefinite pronouns (e.g., I, me, my; they, them, their; anyone, everything).
meta: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking.

content: Use singular and plural nouns with matching verbs in basic sentences (e.g., He hops; We hop).
meta: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking.

content: Use common, proper, and possessive nouns.
meta: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking.

content: Print all upper- and lowercase letters.
meta: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking.

content: Memorize and recite poems, rhymes, and songs with expression.
meta: Describe people, places, things, and events with relevant details, expressing ideas and feelings clearly.

content: Give, restate, and follow simple two-step directions.
meta: Ask and answer questions about key details in a text read aloud or information presented orally or through other media.

content: Ask questions to clear up any confusion about the topics and texts under discussion.
meta: Participate in collaborative conversations with diverse partners about grade 1 topics and texts with peers and adults in small and larger groups

content: Build on others' talk in conversations by responding to the comments of others through multiple exchanges.
meta: Participate in collaborative conversations with diverse partners about grade 1 topics and texts with peers and adults in small and larger groups

content: Follow agreed-upon rules for discussions (e.g., listening to others with care, speaking one at a time about the topics and texts under discussion).
meta: Participate in collaborative conversations with diverse partners about grade 1 topics and texts with peers and adults in small and larger groups

content: Use context to confirm or self-correct word recognition and understanding, rereading as necessary.
meta: Read with sufficient accuracy and fluency to support comprehension.

content: Read on-level text orally with accuracy, appropriate rate, and expression on successive readings.
meta: Read with sufficient accuracy and fluency to support comprehension.

content: Read on-level text with purpose and understanding.
meta: Read with sufficient accuracy and fluency to support comprehension.

content: Recognize and read grade-appropriate irregularly spelled words.
meta: Know and apply grade-level phonics and word analysis skills in decoding words both in isolation and in text.

content: Read words with inflectional endings.
meta: Know and apply grade-level phonics and word analysis skills in decoding words both in isolation and in text.

content: Decode two-syllable words following basic patterns by breaking the words into syllables.
meta: Know and apply grade-level phonics and word analysis skills in decoding words both in isolation and in text.

content: Use knowledge that every syllable must have a vowel sound to determine the number of syllables in a printed word.
meta: Know and apply grade-level phonics and word analysis skills in decoding words both in isolation and in text.

content: Know final -e and common vowel team conventions for representing long vowel sounds.
meta: Know and apply grade-level phonics and word analysis skills in decoding words both in isolation and in text.

content: Decode regularly spelled one-syllable words.
meta: Know and apply grade-level phonics and word analysis skills in decoding words both in isolation and in text.

content: Know the spelling-sound correspondences for common consonant digraphs.
meta: Know and apply grade-level phonics and word analysis skills in decoding words both in isolation and in text.

content: Segment spoken single-syllable words into their complete sequence of individual sounds (phonemes).
meta: Demonstrate understanding of spoken words, syllables, and sounds (phonemes).

content: Isolate and pronounce initial, medial vowel, and final sounds (phonemes) in spoken single-syllable words.
meta: Demonstrate understanding of spoken words, syllables, and sounds (phonemes).

content: Orally produce single-syllable words by blending sounds (phonemes), including consonant blends.
meta: Demonstrate understanding of spoken words, syllables, and sounds (phonemes).

content: Distinguish long from short vowel sounds in spoken single-syllable words.
meta: Demonstrate understanding of spoken words, syllables, and sounds (phonemes).

content: Recognize the distinguishing features of a sentence (e.g., first word, capitalization, ending punctuation).
meta: Demonstrate understanding of the organization and basic features of print.

content: Confirm predictions about what will happen next in a text.
meta: With prompting and support, read informational texts appropriately complex for grade 1.
Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

content: Activate prior knowledge related to the information and events in a text.
meta: With prompting and support, read informational texts appropriately complex for grade 1.

content: Confirm predictions about what will happen next in a text.
meta: With prompting and support, read prose and poetry of appropriate complexity for grade 1.

content: Activate prior knowledge related to the information and events in a text.
meta: With prompting and support, read prose and poetry of appropriate complexity for grade 1.
